title.narrative: 2.1 STRENGTHENING CP SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 2: Protective and learning environment Programme Component Results (PCR) 3: Adolescent participation and empowerment

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygieneespecially for the most deprived communities

No. of states in which DCPU of at least one district is able to establish functional block and village level structures for protection of children (including Child Protection Committees, School Management Committees)

actual.value: 2014:At least 12 states with at least two districts each have functional district and village level protection structures exceeding the target set.

title.narrative: No. of states in which at least 10% DCPUs are able to {a) State specific guidelines, programme design, norms and standards to implement FS & NIAC programmes [including sponsorship and foster-care] in place (b) District Sponsorship and Foster Care Approval Committees (DSFCAC) established, (c) DCPUs, DSFCACs, CWCs, and NGOs trained on FS & NIAC programme components and implementation guidelines} implement Family Strengthening and Non-institutional Alternative Care Interventions (FS& NIAC)

actual.value: 2014:At least 4 states have models of family strengthening interventions. At the national level also technical support to formulate guidelines on foster care has been provided

title.narrative: No. of states in which JJ functionaries {These will include (a) CWC members, (b) JJB members, (c) SJPUs and CWPOs} at district level are adequately equipped {(a) CWCs and JJBs established with functionaries, staff, and infrastructure as per norms, (c) CWC and JJB personnel trained on Child Protection, JJ Act, and ICPS, (d) SJPUs established and CWPOs trained on Child Protection, JJ Act, and ICPS} to implement provisions of the JJ Act

actual.value: 2014:14 states have district level JJ functionaries from CWC.JJB and SJPU that have been equipped with knowledge and tools to perform their roles and responsibilities.

title.narrative: No. of states with anti-trafficking initiatives on one or more of the following: a) capacity building of law enforcement (AHTUs, SJPUs, CWC etc.), b) SOPs and procedures for coordination, c) strengthening of rehabilitation, reintegration, including Ujjawala implementation (New indicator added in June 2014)

baseline.value: Draft SOPs (interstate & cross-border),1 state conducted training of police or law enforcement personnel on trafficking.

target.value: 2017:SOPs to ensure coordination for rescue and return of trafficked children in 2 states, Minimum 3 states with enhanced capacities to effectively implement and monitor reintegration programmes for GoI (U

actual.value: 2014:9 states have on going initiatives ranging from support to rehabilitation, capacity building and community work. Maharashtra and West Bengal have signed the SOP for RRRI, 5 states have worked on rehabilitation and two states on capacity building.

title.narrative: No. of states in which the SCPS and DCPUs are adequately equipped (Adequately equipped DCPUs (a) Critical staff at SCPS and DCPU in place as per the ICPS norms, (b) Annual State Child Protection Plans and SitAns and Annual District Child Protection Plans available, (c) SCPS and DCPU Staff trained on Child Protection, JJ Act, and ICPS) to implement ICPS

baseline.value: Structures being put in place progressively in all states.

actual.value: 2014:14 States with more than 25% DCPUs per state have functional structures in place
